Henricus Octavus Dei gracia Anglie et Francie Rex
ffidei defensor et dominus hibernie Omnibus ad quos presentes littere pervenerint. Salutem. Sciatis quod nos considerantes pium propositum dilectorum nobis Thome West militis domini
la Warr Georgii Croft Capellani nostri Roberti Thorne Nicholei Thorne Ville noste Bristollie et Johannis Godryche clerici executoris testamenti Roberti Thorne defuncti in fundacione continuacione
et supportacione cuiusdam Scole gramaticalis in dicta Villa Bristollie aut in suburbiis eiusdem Ville pro pueris in eadem Scola erudiendis in bonis moribis et litteraturis pro meliori sustentacione
unious magistri et unius hostiarii sive duorum hostiariorum eisudem et aliarum rerum necessariarum ibidem faciendi ac gracia nostra speciali ac ex certa sciencia et mero moti nostris concessimus et
licenciam dedimus ac per presentes concedimus et licenciam damus pro nobis et heredibus et heredibus nostris quantum in nobis est maiori burgensibus et commutati dict Ville Bristollie et successoribus
suis quod ipsi et sucessores sui acquiere et recipere possint domum sive hospitale sanct Bartholomei in dicte villa nostra Bristollie domina maneria mesuagia terras tenementa Gardina pomaria
prata pasturas pasturas redditus reveriones servicia cum omnibus suis iuribus proficuis et commoditatibus que nunc sunt aut aliquo tempore preterito acceptum sive reputatum fuerunt ut parcella euisdem

Henry the Eighth, by the grace of God, King of England and France, defender of the faith and lord of Ireland. To all those whom these present letters shall come. Greetings. Know that we considering the blessed purpose of our beloved to us Thomas West, knight, lord La Warr, George Croft our chaplain, Robert Thorne, Nicholas Thorne of our town of Bristol and John Godryche, clerk, executor of the will of Robert Thorne, deceased, in the foundation, continuation and support of a certain grammar school in the said town of Bristol or in the suburbs of the same town for children in the same school to be instructed in good customs and learning for the better maintenance of one master and one usher or two ushrs of the same and other things requisite in the same place made of our special grace and our certain knowledge and mere motion we have granted and given license for us and our heirs in so far as we are able to the mayor, burgesses and commonality of the saids town of Bristol and their successors that themselves and their successors be able to acquire and receive the house or hospital of Saint Bartholomew in our said town of Bristol, and the demense lands, manors, messuages, lands, tenements, gardens, orchards, meadows, pastures, pastures, rents, reversions, services with all their rights, profits and advantages which are now or any time past have been accepted or considered or parcel of the same
